file_content.text: It'll be years before the Republic realizes its mistake.
The whitefangs are dead.
It's done.
Perfect. Now the Republic will waste years trying to tame the dim-witted offal.
It'd be funny if it wasn't so... oh, who am I kidding? It's totally funny.
I agree.
Always nice to see someone who enjoys their work.
Don't forget my part.
I'll certainly let my superiors know of your involvement. Other than that, though, this operation will have to remain a secret.
Naturally, I'd prefer you be discrete about this. We obviously can't have the Republic know.
You're an idiot.
If you say so. Nonetheless, the job is done. Another point to the Empire.
Give me credits.
Of course--here's a little compensation for your time. Thanks for your help.
Make sure you're thorough--I don't want a trained whitefang coming after me someday. The irony alone would kill me.
Of course they're safe to eat, I--look, whoever told you they were poisonous is a blasted liar....
Oh... your pardon, my lord. I was just offering some... nutritional advice to a few Republic scouts.
Ah, greetings. I was just sharing my nutritional expertise with some Republic scouts.
I'm Kinto Symms, Imperial infiltration. I've been monitoring the Republic forces and bombarding them with misinformation.
Those saps will believe anything. Even now, I've got them scrambling to tame pantran whitefangs--a colossal waste of time and money.
What sparked their interest?
How did you manage that?
I let it slip that whitefangs could be trained as attack mounts, which is true... to an extent.
Tell me about the whitefangs.
What are those?
I'm not interested in childish pranks.
Sounds petty.
Oh, it's more than a mere prank.
Whitefangs are unrivaled predators--exceedingly fast and deadly. We've lost more scouts to them than to the enemy.
The Republic has been rounding them up by the hundreds, spending millions on training them.
What they don't realize is that few whitefangs develop the intelligence necessary for domestication. They'll be lucky to tame twenty.
So their operation will be a disaster.
That's quite the ruse.
You've no idea. The Republic has already lost countless men to the incessant cold and the whitefangs'... fangs. Some amusing casualty reports.
You're positive?
Trust me, there's no way the Republic will recoup its losses on this project.
You seem rather pleased with yourself.
Feeling smug?
I'm stationed alone in the middle of a very cold nowhere. Indulging my ego is one of my few pleasures.
Still... I imagine someone with your power could cripple the Republic's efforts even further, my lord.
Still... I wasn't expecting to find a certified bounty hunter out here. Perhaps we can up the ante a little bit.
Still... few know how to undermine the Republic like you, sir. Perhaps you could help me take this scheme to the next level.
Still... now that you're here, perhaps we can up the ante.
If you can exterminate the few trainable whitefangs, the Republic will toil without producing one combat-worthy specimen. Drain their resources and keep our people safe.
Slaughtering whitefangs ought to provide worthy sport.
I enjoy a challenge.
A few mangy beasts are no match for the dark side.
Leave it to me.
I never hunt for free.
It'll cost you.
I suppose a few credits is worth the millions the Republic stands to lose.
The Republic will pay for its incompetence.
This is what I do.
It's a solid plan.
Excellent. The Republic will be left depleted and demoralized.
You'll find the whitefangs in packs, but the smarter ones tend to hunt alone. They've earned their reputation, so be careful.
I'm busy. [Refuse quest]
I was hoping to perfect my plan. I'll be here if you change your mind.
I need to sort through all this Republic comm chatter.
